keyword: how many calories in an old fashioned
title: How Many Calories in an Old Fashioned?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in an old fashioned cocktail, including carbs, sugars, alcohol content, and recipe tweaks for lower calories.
h1: How Many Calories in an Old Fashioned?
assumptions: Standard recipe: 2 oz bourbon whiskey, 1 sugar cube (4 g), 2 dashes Angostura bitters, orange twist; stirred with ice, no added soda.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by whiskey brand, pour size, sugar amount, and garnishes; homemade vs. bar versions differ. Consult sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: An Old Fashioned has about 155 calories, primarily from the bourbon and sugar.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use a sugar substitute (e.g., stevia) instead of sugar cube
Add 1 oz soda water (splash for Old Fashioned variation)
Double sugar (2 cubes) for sweeter version

faqs.q: How many calories in an old fashioned without sugar?
faqs.a: About 140 kcal, mostly from the 2 oz bourbon.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in an old fashioned?
faqs.a: The whiskey (around 140 kcal) and sugar (15 kcal); bitters add negligible amounts.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in an old fashioned?
faqs.a: Yes, about 6 g from the sugar; no fiber.

faqs.q: How does bar vs. home Old Fashioned calorie count differ?
faqs.a: Bar versions may use larger pours or extra sugar, increasing to 200+ kcal; home control keeps it around 155.

faqs.q: Can I make a low-calorie old fashioned?
faqs.a: Yes, swap sugar for a zero-calorie sweetener and use a lighter whiskey pour to drop under 150 kcal.
